title: 'off_t' undeclared with gcc 4.8.5 on Linux
body_html:
(similar to #3611): with gcc 4.8.5 on Linux I get the following error (with the head from yesterday 1bf717e ):

/home/users/aholz/pytorch-head/aten/src/TH/THDiskFile.c:186:30: error: 'off_t' undeclared (first use in this function)
   if(fseeko(dfself->handle, (off_t)position, SEEK_SET) < 0)

Adding #include <sys/types.h> in aten/src/TH/THDiskFile.c fixes this.

Should I open a new pull request for this (similar to #3612, with guard against _WIN32) or piggyback on #3612 ?

body:
(similar to #3611): with gcc 4.8.5 on Linux I get the following error (with the head from yesterday 1bf717e ):

```
/home/users/aholz/pytorch-head/aten/src/TH/THDiskFile.c:186:30: error: 'off_t' undeclared (first use in this function)
   if(fseeko(dfself->handle, (off_t)position, SEEK_SET) < 0)
```

Adding `#include <sys/types.h>` in `aten/src/TH/THDiskFile.c` fixes this. 

Should I open a new pull request for this (similar to #3612, with guard against `_WIN32`) or piggyback on #3612 ?
